articles.headline: Central Bankers to Lend Billions in Credit Crisis
articles.snippet: Led by the Fed, five central banks announced an aggressive infusion of capital into the banking system, hoping to ease the credit crunch.
articles.abstract: Led by the Fed, five central banks announced an aggressive infusion of capital into the banking system, hoping to ease the credit crunch.
articles.lead_paragraph: A day after the Federal Reserve disappointed investors with a modest cut in interest rates, central banks in North America and Europe on Wednesday announced the most aggressive infusion of capital into the banking system since the terrorist attacks of September 2001.
articles.byline: By Vikas Bajaj and Floyd Norris

articles.headline: A Chapter of ‘Jackass’ as Web Test
articles.snippet: Paramount Pictures is lurching onto the Web with its “Jackass” franchise, with what it says will be the first studio-backed feature film to have its premiere online.
articles.abstract: Paramount Pictures is lurching onto the Web with its “Jackass” franchise, with what it says will be the first studio-backed feature film to have its premiere online.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  Paramount Pictures is lurching onto the Web with its “Jackass” franchise, with what it says will be the first studio-backed feature film to have its premiere online. And the studio hopes the result will be considerably more pleasurable than the old MTV show’s trademark shot to the groin  perhaps by paving the way for more profit-making Web-only material.

articles.headline: A Voice to Guide You on the Road
articles.snippet: Searching for G.P.S. models that fulfill three requirements that may keep a driver from grunting, panting and swearing.
articles.abstract: Searching for G.P.S. models that fulfill three requirements that may keep a driver from grunting, panting and swearing.
articles.lead_paragraph: G.P.S. didn’t always stand for Global Positioning System, you know.

articles.headline: Charity’s Share From Shopping Raises Concern
articles.snippet: Experts on nonprofits are starting to question the practice of building donations into the purchase of retail products.
articles.abstract: Experts on nonprofits are starting to question the practice of building donations into the purchase of retail products.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shopping has become virtuous, especially at this time of year. Buy a “Better World” scarf at American Eagle Outfitters, and the retailer says $10 of the $19.95 price will go to one of three charities. Buy or lease a BMW this month, and participating dealers say they will give $25 to the Make-A-Wish Foundation.

articles.headline: After Clashes, Fear of War on Congo’s Edge
articles.snippet: A confrontation between the Congolese Army and a Tutsi general is plunging the country back toward war.
articles.abstract: A confrontation between the Congolese Army and a Tutsi general is plunging the country back toward war.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAKE, Congo  A major confrontation between the Congolese Army and a renegade general is plunging the country back toward war, threatening to undermine the fledgling democratic state and set off a new regional conflict on a scale not seen here in years.

articles.headline: Countrywide Subpoenaed by Illinois
articles.snippet: The Illinois attorney general has subpoenaed documents from Countrywide Financial, broadening an investigation into lending practices that has already led to a lawsuit against one mortgage broker.
articles.abstract: The Illinois attorney general has subpoenaed documents from Countrywide Financial, broadening an investigation into lending practices that has already led to a lawsuit against one mortgage broker.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Illinois attorney general is investigating the home loan unit of Countrywide Financial as part of the state’s expanding inquiry into dubious lending practices that have trapped borrowers in high-cost mortgages they can no longer afford.

articles.headline: In a Funk, Italy Sings an Aria of Disappointment
articles.snippet: For all of Italy’s outside adoration, the country finds itself in an economic, political and social funk.
articles.abstract: For all of Italy’s outside adoration, the country finds itself in an economic, political and social funk.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROME  All the world loves Italy because it is old but still glamorous. Because it eats and drinks well but is rarely fat or drunk. Because it is the place in a hyper-regulated Europe where people still debate with perfect intelligence what, really, the red in a stoplight might mean.

articles.headline: India, a Stirring Giant, Is the New Place to See and Be Seen
articles.snippet: A soaring economy and crumbling trade barriers are making India a “must visit” destination for foreign politicians and executives.
articles.abstract: A soaring economy and crumbling trade barriers are making India a “must visit” destination for foreign politicians and executives.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI  If it’s Monday, it must be Romania  and Finland and Minnesota.

articles.headline: From a Critic of Tribunals to Top Judge
articles.snippet: The chief judge of the military commissions at Guantánamo Bay once wrote a paper criticizing the use of such tribunals to try suspects held there.
articles.abstract: The chief judge of the military commissions at Guantánamo Bay once wrote a paper criticizing the use of such tribunals to try suspects held there.
articles.lead_paragraph: Back in 2002, a master’s degree candidate at the Naval War College wrote a paper on the Bush administration’s plan to use military commissions to try Guantánamo suspects, concluding that “even a good military tribunal is a bad idea.”

articles.headline: Patients Wonder Whether to Replace a Wire That Might Fail
articles.snippet: Thousands of patients with failing hearts must decide whether to heed a warning from Medtronic and replace a defibrillator in their chest that has a potentially faulty wire.
articles.abstract: Thousands of patients with failing hearts must decide whether to heed a warning from Medtronic and replace a defibrillator in their chest that has a potentially faulty wire.
articles.lead_paragraph: MORRISTOWN, N.J.  For one heart patient, there will be no more agonizing over whether the implanted device meant to save his life might kill him instead.

articles.headline: Immigration, and Its Politics, Shake Rural Iowa
articles.snippet: The struggle over immigration may seem distant in states like Iowa, but the debate is part of daily life in Storm Lake.
articles.abstract: The struggle over immigration may seem distant in states like Iowa, but the debate is part of daily life in Storm Lake.
articles.lead_paragraph: STORM LAKE, Iowa  Along the main thoroughfare of this small meatpacking town, the transformation of a single shop, once known as the Ken-A-Bob restaurant, tells the story of the town itself.
